item.description:
Players take on the role of adventurers and race to gather mysterious creatures in this otherworldly safari.

The cards:
• Adventure cards provide step-by-step instructions to setup and play through each round.
• Shinies are the gemmed bugs that players try to capture during adventures.
• Catchies represent the items and methods used to capture shinies.
• Missions are the assignments given to players during the game to be completed for bounties. (Requirement varies.)
• Bounties award/ represent treasure, the currency used to determine the winner. (Reward amount varies.)

Setup:
• Players start by separating the cards into five draw stacks by type (adventures, shinies, catchies, missions, and bounties).
• Each player draws 5 catchies to form their hand.
• Each player draws 1 mission to complete.
That's it, you're ready to play!

Gameplay:
Get the shinies is broken down into a series of rounds known as "adventures".

• Before each round players replenish their hand of catchies, as necessary (up to the maximum of five).
• At the beginning of each round an adventure card is placed into the center of the play area to guide players through the setup and gameplay of each round.
• Players then take alternating turns matching their catchies with shinies to capture them as directed by the adventure card until the round is over.
• At the end of each round players check to see if they've captured enough shinies to complete their mission. If enough shinies have been captured the player: exchanges the required number of shinies for a bounty card, discards the completed mission along with the required shinies, and draws a new mission.

This process is repeated until 10 missions have been completed collectively, ending the game.

When the game ends players discard any remaining missions, shinies, or catchies they have then reveal their bounty cards and add up their values. The player with the highest treasure value wins the game!

You'll need to manage your hand of catchies wisely while consistently making the right plays to hinder your opponent and advance yourself to ensure victory in this unpredictable contest because it's not a game of chance!

-description from designer

Eleições 20XX is about a fictional election in a fictional place. There are voter cards on the table, which show one or two preferences. Players use whatever it takes to make sure that voters who'd never vote for them anyway won't participate in the election, while those who might, vote for the right thing. 
The player who gets the most votes at election time wins.

Vossa Excelência: O Jogo Político (Your Excellency: The Political Game) is a card game about dirty politics. Players are elected office holders and have four years to consolidate their power to ensure re-election. They have to abuse their power to get enough votes and silence the opposition.

item.description:
In prehistoric times, players strive to become the leader of their clan by being the most skillful farter, which they achieve when everyone else has passed out from the smells.

Uga-Uga Bufapum is a "take that" card game in which you play cards that either affect specific other players or the whole village. Players also might get the chance to eat meals to improve their farting abilities. The effect of each card is noted on it; aside from a "draw 2, play 2" rule, there seem to be few other rules in the game.

Tá na Mesa is a game about a cooking contest between famous chefs who must prepare traditional dishes. To prepare a dish, one must collect the required ingredient cards, then combine dishes to achieve the best presentation in order to win the game.

item.description:
In the café La Once, there is a special activity each year in which the guests must play about their food. Only those who play out the finals will be served the tastiest food in a special room. The (fictional) café has now decided to publish the game that is played.

In La 11 Coffee & Tea Party, players have to collect sets of the same cards to grab the sweet dishes on the table. For two of the same card, one may take the corresponding dish from the center of the table; for three of the same, one may steal it from another player. When a player has collected the three dishes in their secret mission card, that player wins. Special cards spice up the game flow.

Rather than being packaged in a box, the game comes in a cookie bag.

In Pop Rocket, you place the rocket in the middle of the playing area, pull the fuse, then wait for the rocket to pop! Quickly place your colored bowls around the rocket. As soon as the rocket opens, a colorful shower of stars flies through the air! Catch the most stars when the rocket pops to win!

Kwirky is a fast-moving, quick-thinking, question-and-answer, bluff-and-banter game for family and friends., and in this game you decide the answers!

Answer against the clock, even if you don't know, by convincing others you do! Beware because players may call your bluff! Younger players compete on equal terms since quick wit and cheeky confidence are what you need in this game where all the answers are up for grabs.

Penny Assassin is a dice chucking assassination game for 1-4 players.

Run across rooftops, hide from guards, look for the perfect shot, and then slay the targets. The enemy guards are constantly on the move, so the players must look for the opportune passage to strike.

In Penny Assassin, you start as a lowly member of a gang. As you travel about the town of Rorcester, you get stronger and more powerful. Missions that took multiple turns in the beginning can be accomplished in a flash, at the end. This leads to a mad dash to the finish. Only one can become The Most Awesome Assassin.

1-4 players get 3 actions each, per turn. Players can move unlimited spaces around the board, until they need to perform an action, such as hiding, climbing, or shooting. Events bring new missions and orders for the guards and coppers. Completing missions brings nickels. Nickels and pennies gained can be used to move closer towards victory, or for gaining more power and better tools of the trade. This brings the battle of risk versus reward, as players vie for the best strategy to take down the targets.

Different characters, skills, abilities, weapons, and setups give lots of options to take down the many targets.

Can you become the Most Awesome Assassin?

—description from the publisher

The kids vs grown-ups trivia game where the grown-ups assume to know more than the kids, but is this true?

Kids team up and challenge the grown-ups as to what they know about kids' things. The grown-ups get to test how smart the kids are. The team that gets to the other side of the board first wins and knows best! Sounds easy - but be aware of the special spaces that may help you forward more quickly… or set you back!

—description from the publisher

In Boomerang, the "come-back-again" card game, players travel round the great south land, trying to see and do as much as possible — but will the cards you want to see come back to you?

Boomerang could be described as a card-drafting game (like 7 Wonders or Sushi Go!) mixed with a roll-and-write game (like Yahtzee or Qwixx).

Each turn, players select one card from their hand to play, then pass the rest of their cards to the next player. Will you take what you really want, or a different card so as to deprive another player of something cool?

At the end of each round, players mark different things off on their score sheets, corresponding to what they earned from the cards they selected. Players earn points for seeing sights, collecting Australiana, seeing animals, and so on. After five rounds, the player with the most points wins.

Nerd Battles is a card game for 2-4 players where nerds of all kinds fight for victory. Each nerd card has a base attack, defense, and IQ. Extra attack and defense cards can be added to a nerd in battle, where their IQ value is the amount of extra cards they can add. A nerd's attack and defense values can also be boosted by adding a confidence token. Defeat 4 nerds and you win!

Everyone starts the game with 2 nerd cards, 4 battle cards, and 4 random confidence tokens. At the start of a turn, draw 1 nerd card, or 2 battle cards. Then choose to pit your nerd against an opponents' to start a battle, or simply play an action card. If you start a nerd battle, choose the player you want to attack, and put your nerd into play. Add battle cards to your nerd to increase their attack defense, keeping the number of cards at or under their IQ value. At this time, a confidence token can also be added to the nerd. If the token matches the nerd, they get a permanent +2 to attack and defense. If it's unmatching, it's only a +1 to those values, and is discarded at the end of the battle.

Then, the opponent needs to put a nerd into play to defend the attack. If they can successfully block the attack by getting enough defense to equal or be greater than the attack, they not only don't lose, but they may be able to add enough attack cards to counter attack and defeat the attacking nerd. They are still limited by the nerds IQ, but can also add a confidence token. Either way, the losing nerd hides in the winners basement (an area under the play area) and gets turned sideways. After the battle, all battle cards are discarded, but any nerds that didn't lose stay in play, face up. Discard down to 7 battle cards, and it's the next player's turn. First player to get 4 nerds in their basement wins!

-description from designer

Hero Team Quest is a co-op game designed for young children. Very few board games that kids are exposed to emphasize cooperation and team success. With Hero Team Quest, all the players compete together and the outcome of victory or defeat is shared by all players. The goal is to defeat the wizard before time runs out (when the goblin gives the crystal of magic to him). The goblin moves 2 spaces on the board every round, closer to the end. Players must get to the end and defeat the wizard before he gets there.

Players first form a hero team of four characters and each may obtain a magic power at the magic school - each power is a weakness of one of the four bosses in the game. As they move across the board, they look to avoid losing a turn by stepping in mud. Players stop on the battle spaces to roll the dice to defeat the various bosses. Certain powers will make the chance of success better for some characters. If you should lose, you go to the cage where you must roll a 1 on your turn to pick the lock. Otherwise, other players may come to your rescue if they should defeat the boss OR they can decide to continue on the path if time is of the essence.

The game does offer some choices and teamwork/communication, but is ultimately a simple game designed for young kids that is easy to follow. From a complexity standpoint, it's a step up from games such as Candyland, Chutes and Ladders, Sorry, etc. - but in a genre that most kids enjoy.

—description from the publisher

Game covers battle at Byczyna, fought 24 January 1588 near Byczyna at Silesa. It was the deciding battle of the 1587–1588 War of the Polish Succession, which erupted after two rival candidates were elected to the Polish throne.
Game uses Husaria system.

Unlock! Exotic Adventures features three new "escape room" scenarios that you can play on your tabletop.

Unlock! is a cooperative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc. The three scenarios are (according to the app):

- Night of the Boogeymen
 - Scheherazade's Last Tale
 - Expedition: Challenger

item.description:
There are eggs all over the place! You are the chicken, and you have to grab, stand, and hide these crazy eggs to get them. The players must act quickly based on the directions given by a die in order to get an egg. The first person to act correctly gains an egg, but sometimes the slowest person loses an egg.

When the top of the die is red, the first person to act correctly takes the egg on the stand, then rolls the placement die and places the egg on the indicated location of their body. When the top of the die is blue, the last person to act returns one egg back to the egg box. If this player doesn't have any egg, nothing more happens.

The first player to collect five eggs wins Crazy Eggz (or the player who has the most eggs if all ten eggs are taken). Take as many eggs as possible, and be the best chicken of all!

Crazy Eggz is a new edition of Dancing Eggs (Eiertanz) with new artwork, actions and rules.

item.description:
Winner of both the Judges' and People's Choice awards for 'Best Abstract Game' at the UK Games Expo 2018, and of Imagination Gaming's 'Family Gold Award'.

In Thieves, two players compete to steal a hoard of gold from the heart of a dragon’s lair. Through a labyrinth, with doorways that open and close with every roll of a pair of dice, they direct the moves and actions of their gangs of thieves. Players have three goals: to take the treasure, to keep it, and to escape with it.

Throughout the game its dice deliver sudden reversals of fortune, challenging players’strategic skills by compelling them to keep adapting their plans. Every game played will be different and, whilst luck may affect the outcome of individual games, superior use of strategy will determine the winner of a series.

The rules only take a few minutes to learn. Games typically take 30 minutes, although fortune with the dice, the skill of the players, and the speed of play can result in shorter or longer times.

—description from the designer

item.description:
The Land of Oz is shifting. Help the Scarecrow, the Tin Woodsman, the Cowardly Lion, and Dorothy to make a colorful and magic world where the mountains, seas and deserts live together with the poppy fields, the forests and, of course, the Yellow Brick Road. Glenda — the good witch of the north — will help you, but be careful because Mombi — the wicked witch of the west — will not make it easy for you.

Oziland is a family game of tile placement, fast and beautiful, with two game modes. In the first one each player builds their own Land of Oz in their playzone with the help of characters from the book. In the second play mode, all the players have to build the Land of Oz in a race to discover who is the most glorious builder in this fantastic world.

•••

El Reino de Oz está cambiando. Ayuda al Espantapájaros, al Leñador de Hojalata, al León Cobarde y a Dorothy a crear un colorido y mágico mundo, en el que sus montañas, mares y desiertos convivan con sus campos de amapolas, sus bosques y, por supuesto, el camino de baldosas amarillas. La Bruja Glenda os ayudará, pero cuidado con la Bruja del Oeste… no está por la labor de colaborar.

Oziland es un juego familiar de colocación de losetas, rápido y vistoso, que tiene dos modos de juego distintos: en el primero, cada jugador construirá su propio reino de Oz en su zona de juego ayudado por las habilidades de los personajes del famoso libro, mientras que en el segundo modo todos los jugadores construirán Oz en el centro de la mesa, en una carrera para ver quién es el primero que se queda sin losetas en la mano.

item.description:
Quatre-Bras 1815: Last Eagles is the fourth game in the Eagles of France serie to be released in Q1 2019. More simulation of a Napoleonic battle rather than just a re-creation.

At Quatre-Bras, Wellington's army arrived at the last minute to counter Ney's advancing troops. At the end of the day, the Anglo-Allied outnumbered the French and were able to counter attack.

Several scenarios are available: Quatre-bras historical, Quatre-bras with variable reinforcements (what if D'Erlon or Uxbridge had arrived?), and two other what if scenarios: Ney's morning attack, Wellington already concentrated versus Ney

This game will link up with Ligny 1815: Last Eagles to provide a full campaign experience with interaction between both battles. Using hidden units with fog of war and variable reinforcements, the players will be as close as possible to the real life situation. Where are the French attacking? When exactly my reinforcements will arrive?

-description from designer

name.value: Rush in the Forest: Three Little Pigs

item.description:
Rush in the forest: Three Little Pigs - is a family board game. All the components of the game are made from ecofriendly plywood. The game board and the rest of the elements are assembled as a constructor in the 3-d puzzle format. The glue is not required for the game assembling. Age for self-assembly of the components of the game is 14+. Age to participate with the game is 8+. Gameplay - throw a dice's, go your character (pig) on the playing board and collect resources for building a house. During the game, you may be hampered by a secondary character (Wolf) or accidentally dropped effect cards (which may both interfere and help you). The goal of the game is to assemble the house faster than the other players.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Zombie Doctor: The Classic Horror Expansion Pack

item.description:
The Zombie Doctor world is officially growing with The Classic Horror Expansion Pack.

These are four iconic characters which can be mixed with the original characters from the base Zombie Doctor game, or played with as a standalone game. Pain or Gain Cards from the base Zombie Doctor game will be needed and not supplied with the expansion pack.

The characters are:


 Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
 The Mummy
 The Invisible Man
 Dracula


The characters' design are inspired by the old films and classic novels. They're incredibly suitable for the game's mechanics as they turn from one thing into another! Perfect for fans of the classics or a great addition to your horror games.

—description from the publisher

link.value: Zombie Doctor: The Zombie Card Game

item.description:
A bunch of cards have all kinds of different sheep on them. On your turn you draw one card at random from the player to your right and then play as many sheep cards as you want, telling a story to connect them as you go along. Then the other players vote on whether the story made sense or not; if at least half say yes, you can just discard the cards, otherwise you have to draw to replace them.

The goal is to get rid of all your cards. However, the game continues until one team wins. The only catch is, nobody knows what team they're on until they run out of cards! Cards that tell you what team you're on are dealt at the start of the game but are kept face-down and unchecked until you run out of cards. This keeps voting honest even as the game goes on.

While the rules are in Japanese, the cards have no text, so the game can be played in any language.

-- user summary

item.description:
Out of Line: Nature Calls is a leg-crossing game of Russian roulette. A stand-alone expansion of our Out of Line series, players race to the front of a line of portable toilets at an outdoor concert. The deck is full of cards to help you cheat your way to the front, but you never can tell when nature might strike. The further you get into the deck the more desperate the race becomes because the clock is always ticking on a full bladder.

To win, you simply have to be the first one to get to a portable toilet without having any accidents along the way. Nature could call at any moment and no one may make it to the front of the line, so use all the tricks up your sleeves to cheat your way to the front.

A player's turn consists of 3 easy steps:
1. Roll a dice and move that line up 
2. Draw a card and hope nature doesn’t strike
3. Take an action (play a card, move to the back of a line or just discard a card)

Player cards allow you to do things like:
• Move a player to the end of a line
• Force a player out of line
• Let a foodie cut into the front of the line
• Add people to the end of a line
• Temporarily close down a portable toilet
• Stop another player from playing a card

-description from designer

Politics is a terrible and scary race to be in. Everyone has scandals, big and small, that they wish wouldn't see the light of day. However, the press always seems to find them...

In Indictment, players are politicians who are working hard to bury their scandals before the press can find them. Each turn, players play either scandal cards or cover-up cards. A player then chooses which scandal to reveal, hoping the next, bigger scandal is just around the corner to occupy the press. If they can't play a same level (number) of scandal or higher, they have to pick up all the revealed scandals. If you play the same level (i.e. same number) of scandal as your opponent, they can stack and give you special bonus actions.

Eventually, once you've eliminated of all your hidden scandals, you can finally get to putting those nagging open scandals behind you, knowing you will not be the last one left in the press.

There are no winners in this game of politics, with only the last one left holding onto scandals being indicted and losing.

name.value: Avec Honneur et Panache: Volume 1 – Turenne

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

A wargame covering two battles lead by Turenne: Rethel 1650 and Les Dunes 1658.
Original system by Ben Hull, also used by Paris vaut bien une Messe! and Avec Infini Regret series.

• Rethel 1650 – 15 December 1650, With Mazarin having imprisoned the Prince of Condé at the beginning of the year for fear of his growing influence, the troops supporting the Prince rallied behind Turenne who had recently gone to the Fronde’s side. Turenne operated in the northeast of France to join the troops of the Duc de Lorraine and the Spanish with hopes of regaining control of all the fortresses acquired in Condé’s cause.
Sensing the danger of having such a great captain against him, Mazarin entrusted the command of the armies of Flanders and Champagne to the Comte de Plessis-Praslin (meanwhile beginning secret negotiations with the other camp). Plessis-Praslin lay siege to Rethel and, despite having given his word, the governor of Rethel surrendered a few days before Turenne’s arrival. The commander of the Frondeur army was therefore required to combat the entire Royalist army.
After his defeat (which would be the last one), Turenne joined the king’s camp in exchange for amnesty, a few titles and, most importantly, the command of the French armies. He would be a loyal servant of the king until his death on the battlefield 25 years later.

• The Dunes 1658 – 14 June 1658, The alliances had evolved since the end of the Thirty Years’ War. The Lorraine soldiers had gone over to the French camp after their duke was imprisoned by the Spanish. Mazarin convinced King Louis XIV to sign a military alliance with Cromwell who sent a strong English contingency to the continent, thereby forcing King Charles II and Princes James and Henry to join the Spanish with their meagre troops. Exiled with those loyal to him for nearly six years, Condé was also on the side of Juan of Austria, the commander in chief of the Spanish forces.
When Turenne lay siege to the fortress of Dunkirk, Juan of Austria decided to give battle right away. Condé declared to James “Sir, today you will see how to lose a battle”.
As a result of this French victory, the Treaty of the Pyrenees and other related agreements were signed, putting an end to the Franco-Spanish War, to some extent the Fronde, and the English Civil War . The sun of Louis XIV could begin to shine.



Description from the publisher:Jeu d'histoire couvrant 2 batailles menées par Turenne : Rethel 1650, Les Dunes 1658.

Système de jeu dérivé de Paris vaut bien une Messe!, utilisé également par Avec Infini Regret.

• Rethel 1650 – 15 décembre 1650, Le Prince de Condé ayant été emprisonné par Mazarin au début de l’année par peur de son influence grandissante, les troupes clientes du Prince se rallient à Turenne passé depuis peu dans le camp de la Fronde. Ce dernier opère dans le nord-est de la France afin de rejoindre les troupes du Duc de Lorraine et les Espagnols. Il espère pouvoir reprendre le contrôle de toutes les forteresses acquises à la cause de Condé.
De son côté, Mazarin sentant le danger d’avoir un si grand capitaine contre lui donne le commandement des armées de Flandres et de Champagne au comte de Plessis-Praslin (tout en commençant des négociations secrètes avec l’autre camp). Celui-ci met le siège devant Rethel et malgré la parole donnée, le gouverneur de la place se rend quelques jours avant que Turenne n’arrive. Le commandant de l’armée frondeuse se retrouve alors à devoir combattre l’intégralité de l’armée royaliste.
Suite à sa défaite (qui sera la dernière), Turenne rejoindra le camp du roi contre une amnistie, quelques titres et surtout le commandement des armées françaises. Il sera désormais un loyal serviteur du roi jusqu’à sa mort sur un champ de bataille 25 ans plus tard.

• Les Dunes 1658 – 14 juin 1658, Les alliances ont évolué depuis la fin de la guerre de Trente Ans. Les Lorrains sont passés dans le camp des Français suite à l’emprisonnement de leur duc par les Espagnols. Mazarin a décidé le roi Louis XIV à signer une alliance militaire avec Cromwell qui envoie un fort contingent anglais sur le continent. Cela force le roi Charles II et les Princes James et Henry à passer chez les Espagnols avec leurs maigres troupes. En exil avec ses fidèles depuis près de six ans, Condé est également présent aux côtés de Juan de Austria, le commandant en chef des forces espagnoles.
Quand Turenne met le siège devant la forteresse de Dunkerque, Juan de Austria décide de livrer bataille au plus vite. Condé déclarera à James « Monsieur, aujourd’hui vous allez voir comment perdre une bataille ».
Suite à cette victoire française, le traité des Pyrénées ainsi que d’autres accords annexes sera signé mettant fin à la Guerre franco-espagnole et d’une certaine manière à la Fronde ainsi qu’aux Guerres civiles anglaises. Le soleil de Louis XIV pouvait commencer à briller.

A 20 minute old west war game for 2 players

The outlaw David Glynn has been rolling across the west ransacking and looting every town he and his gang come across. Tyler City is next in his cross hairs. The folks of Tyler City know he’s coming and will not go down without a fight. Welcome to the deadly game of maneuvers, counter-maneuvers, and shootouts in the old west. Welcome to the Siege of Tyler City!

The Siege of Tyler City is a quick area control game where each player sets their sides’ actions for the round, then plays out those actions in order. At the end of a round, if one player has met one of their winning conditions, the game ends and that player is the winner.

—description from the publisher

A boardgame published together with Czech biathlon union. It simulates biathlon races. Players roll the dice to move their pawns. Another dice is used for shooting simulation. There are more variant of races. Players can also use some of biathlonist card (best czech racers are included in second revised edition) to improve their skills. The track on board copies the areal in Nové MÄ›sto - one of the most popular tracks in biathlon world cup.

Puzzleboard game (for 2 - 6 people)
 (print&play game)
The board game consists of 6*9=54 piece puzzle element and a regular hexagonal dice. The basic board consists of the common play area which is avilable for everyone, and the 6 individual play areas.
At the beginning of the game, the players agree to wich picture (figure) the each want to complete at wich area. In case of debate, the decision will be made by the dice.
After the decision, the puzzle elements have to be placed at the common play area ofthe hexagon, which can happen according to the player's agreement:
- placed according the chosen picture (figure) at the furthest slice from the individual game area,
- the chosen picture at the furthest slice from the individual game area: mixed,
- the puzzle elements are mixed at the hexagon of the common game area: with the agreement of every player.
Regular movement of the puzzle elements: at the common or individual game area,in patallel with one of the without skipping another element.
After rolling the dice, the number on top of dice will determine the number of steps.
One step is when a player moves a puzzle element to a specific direction: towards the individual game area of the player, without having another puzzle element in the way (without skipinng another element). If there is an element in the way, it should be movedorderly beforhand. If the element not reach individual's game area, it is has to be parked (stored temporarily). In case the puzzle element at the individual game area can only be rotated to the correct position, then it should be moved (orderly) to the O sign first, abd then rotate it here.
The winner is the one who completes the picture (figure) at his own game area.

Planet Earth is struggling under high levels of pollution. Your task is to buy and invest in eco-innovations to build a successful green economy which reduces Earth’s pollution. Along the way you can win bonuses by answering fascinating facts about the world's geography, wildlife and environment. You’ll have to keep an eye on the clock though, as you need to reduce all the pollution before time runs out!

Footprint is a semi-cooperative euro-style card game where players answer bonus questions and buy and invest in eco-innovations to remove pollution cubes from Earth. There are three levels of questions in the game to suit different ages and abilities (beginner, medium and advanced).

The winner is the player who removes the most pollution from Earth, however should players run out of turn cards before all the pollution is removed, everyone loses!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Brink: aim for the edge but don't go over!

item.description:
Brink is a dexterity game for the whole family. It is easy to learn but hard to master.

You throw the plastic cards over the table, aiming to stop the cards on the edge for the highest score. Just a little bit too far and you don't score any points.

In Dragon Fortress you will build an Estate that consists of various crops, farms, barns, mills etc. Also, you must protect these valuable estate assets from approaching dragons, who wish to burn these structures down. Protecting your estate is accomplished by building Fortress Tower structures. A careful balance of Estate and Fortress cards are needed to be victorious in Dragon Fortress. You must have the largest Estate and defeat the dragons!

On your turn you will draw a card and play a card from your hand to your Estate line. This line will build linearly from left to right. You may also draw from the gold supply to help you purchase valuable upgrades for your Estate cards. Drawing from the supply on your turn may introduce a dragon that will attack your estate. The dragon will enter your Estate on the front line and move through each card until it burns your crops or is defeated by your towers.

Victory points are scored for defeating dragons and building the most lucrative Estate. The player with the most victory points after the last dragon is defeated will win the game.

-description from designer

Ukai is a historic form of fishing at night on rivers in Japan, using cormorants to dive for fish. The fish caught are usually ayu (sweetfish). A rope on the bird's throat stops them from swallowing the fish they catch. Once they have caught enough fish for the fishers, the birds are fed.

The most famous location for Ukai in Japan is on the Nagara River (Nagaragawa) in Gifu province. The fishing people go out in long wooden boats, with a large wood fire raised up on the boat to light the way.

In this game, players move up the river, a tableau of cards laid face down. As the fishers move up river, the diving birds reveal cards. Some have sweetfish (1 to 5 points), others have hazards, such as the bird striking a rock. Some cards have special effects too. The game ends when all the 'bonfires' in the game are exhausted, meaning time is out. The player with the highest score in fish is the winner.

The game is published in a tiny matchbox box (no striker), with a deck of small cards and includes matches. It was recently shown on Twitter as the smallest doujin game in Japan.

In a not-so distant future where all art forms have been banished, Hollywood is now just a deserted no-man's land.
You and other has-been dopplegangers get together clandestinely inside a huge Hollywood movie studio, where you take part in crazy (we won't say wacky) races, racing through movie set after movie set, desperately looking for (not Susan, but) fame, props... and Effixium (but mostly Effixium).
You've always dreamed of seeing your favorite heroes from the 80's race each other? With Hollywood Death Race, you won't dream it anymore, you'll live it!
Pick your pilot and your vehicle, and throw yourself in a race full of danger, traps and low blows. Don't trust anyone, stay alert, avoid your opponents special attacks and use yours to win the race!

Gameplay:
On your turn you may choose to perform up to 3 actions among: Move, Use one of your vehicle's abilities, ram, honk or repair.

Each track (movie set) has different rules and you will have to adapt and use them to your advantage in order to outsmart your opponents.

The first player who manages to reach the finish line with his two vehicles wins the race.

-description from publisher

item.description:
Pandas! Bandits! Conservationists! Grandma!
As a Panda: sneak into the Bandit Camp and get your babies back without getting caught.
As a Bandit: catch those sneaky Pandas, while stealing as many baby pandas as you can.
As a Conservationist: protect the Pandas! There aren’t many left!
As Grandma: lead the team, and make some delicious bamboo soup.

Hidden Panda is a team game. 
The Bandit Team consists of all the Bandits. 
They’re trying to work out who everyone is, so they can steal the baby pandas.

The Panda Team consists of Grandma, the Conservationist, and the Pandas. 
They want to keep the Panda’s identities secret, to keep the baby pandas safe from the Bandits.

Starting with Grandma and going clockwise, players hand out 3 baby pandas each turn, then play 1 tea biscuit. When a player gets 3 tea biscuits, players vote on whether or not to net them.

Netted players lose all the baby pandas they've been handed, but do not reveal their role or leave the game. If all Pandas are netted, the Bandit team win!

Otherwise, the team with the most baby pandas at the end of Grandma's third turn is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Welcome to the card-based party game for adults where you create bizarre and hilarious "IF/THEN" statements, which we call Toxic Logic. The game is easy to learn, portable, and tons of fun for 4 or more adults.

Here’s how it works:

Everyone is dealt 5 magenta “THEN” cards. The Dealer flips over a green “IF” card with the beginning of a conditional statement, like “IF you put a habanero pepper up your butt …” The other players each play one “THEN” card face down to the Dealer. The Dealer shuffles the “THEN” cards and then reads each “IF/THEN” combination:

“IF you put a habanero pepper up my butt …”
“THEN we're in for a big, sloppy surprise”
“IF you put a habanero pepper up my butt …”
“THEN these blueprints are all wrong”
“IF you put a habanero pepper up my butt …”
“THEN my new nickname is 'Sharty McFly'”
The Dealer picks a favorite “THEN” card and reads the winning IF/THEN combination out loud:

“IF you put a habanero pepper up my butt …”
“THEN my new nickname is 'Sharty McFly'”
The player of the winning “THEN” card gets a point. Everyone draws back up to 5 “THEN” cards, and the player to the left of the Dealer becomes the Dealer for the next round. You can keep your winning “THEN” cards to keep track of your own score. The first person to reach 5 points wins the game.

Toxic Logic is great for parties with 4 or more adults. You and your friends will have hours of laughs putting together “IF/THEN” statements which are absurd and so funny. Remember, “Toxic Logic” is not for kids! Some of the cards are filthy, and some of them are bizarre. While there is plenty of adult language and potty humor, rest assured that there is no racist or hate-based content. We want it to be fun for all adults! Put it all together, and you've got almost endless hilarity.

—description from the publisher

link.value: Shim and D'rothy Products Worldwide LLC

item.description:
Marvel Strike Teams puts players in the role of some of their favorite Marvel Universe heroes and villains. Two to five players face off in a classic battle of good versus evil. Everyone gets a character with a HeroClix combat dial to track their level and build points. One player is the villainous mastermind and is able to guide the direction of each encounter; the rest are the heroes who each control a single hero for the mission and must work together by combining their vast array of powers and abilities to complete various objectives, such as infiltrating an enemy warehouse or saving hostages.

Each hero is unique with individual play styles, giving players multiple options to play the way that best suits them. The environment also lends to the game play, putting obstacles in the way of players and granting them objects they can use as weapons. A wooden crate may block Captain America's path, but he can pick it up and hurl it at enemy Hydra soldiers. Players will quickly pick the role that best suits their team and lead the heroes to victory — or at least they hope so!

Aside from standalone missions, Marvel Strike Teams includes a campaign-based game in which the players can improve their heroes over the course of several missions. With randomly generated scenarios, multiple map tiles, and thousands of possible encounters, each mission will feel like a fresh experience!

item.description:
Sneak Peaks is an adult NSFW party game of memory, concentration and XXX cartoon boobs.

Sneek Peaks is a naughty game for perverts with a sense of humor. If you are reading this then you most likely are in fact a pervert or know someone who is... *wink*

By definition, pervert means a person whose sexual behavior is regarded as abnormal and unacceptable...

So get ready for a HOT 15 minute funny flashing matching card game.

To play is simple. Just lay out all the cards face down and take turns flipping over 2 cards at a time.

Each scene will be shown a bit different to qualify as a match unlike normal matching games where the image is identical.

The person with the most matches at the end wins!

-description from publisher

item.description:
You want to fight a dragon? Let's think about this a moment...

Setting aside the fact that it has a large mouth full of nasty, sharp, pointy teeth, it outweighs you by about four tons, it flies, and it breathes fire. And you're going to pick up a sharp, pointy stick and wrap yourself in metal skin like some kind of TV dinner waiting to be cooked? Of course you aren't! But the king commands it, and all the other knights are watching, so you have to do something!

I Would Fight The Dragon... is a fun, fast-paced game of bluffing and bluster. Show no fear, make your excuses, and foist gear onto the other knights to help them on their way. One brave soul will be facing the dragon today. Don't let it be you!

link.value: I would Fight the Dragon...: King Promo Card

item.description:
Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 1935 is a game of the factional strife in the Wehrmacht, the unified armed forces of Nazi Germany from 1935 to 1946.
Each player produces troops, performs office hunting by getting "general" cards, commands armed forces in the battle driven by "event" cards and sometimes carries out a coup. If the coup succeeds or WWII ends, the game ends and a player who has been awarded most decorations for victory in the battles wins.

link.value: Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 2: The Conqueror of the Orient 1937

name.value: Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 2: The Conqueror of the Orient 1937
国防軍の夜２ 東洋の覇者-1937-

item.description:
Die Nacht der Wehrmacht 2: The Conqueror of the Orient 1937 is a game of the factional strife in the Army and the Navy of Imperial Japan.
Each player produces troops, performs office hunting by getting "general" cards, commands armed forces in the battle driven by "event" cards and sometimes carries out a coup. If the coup succeeds or WWII ends, the game ends and a player who has been awarded most decorations for victory in the battles wins.

Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #137

Northern Battle, Sekigahara 1600 is a two-player wargame of the Siege of HasedÅ, the Uesugi clan's invasion of the Mogami clan during the Sekigahara Campaign.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Hased%C5%8D

In the early part of the game, Uesugi massively invades and Mogami desperately defends, but the situation dramatically changes after the news of the Western Army's defeat in Sekigahara spreads. Uesugi cannot help retreating and Mogami makes a counterattack.

That’s Wizard is a two-player simultaneous-action card game about dueling wizards. Both players will design a deck of seven spell cards to defeat their opponent with. Spells are organized into seven different schools of magic, such as Transfiguration, Charms, Divination, etc. There are over a thousand possible combinations to create your deck with!

You have two resources to manage, stamina which represents your health, and power which is the magical energy that allows you to cast spells. Each spell has a range of power that you can use to cast it, such that it has a greater effect the more power you use.

You will also have access to the two special action cards; Focus and Counterspell. Focus will bring you back to full power, while counterspell will prevent your opponent’s spell from have an effect, causing them to waste the power they used to cast it. Counterspell costs a bit of your own stamina however, and that cost increases the more you use it! Knowing when to focus, and when to counterspell is the key to victory!

The game is played with a simultaneous action mechanic. Each round, both players secretly choose a card from their hand to play, and secretly set a special dial to show how much power they are using with their card. Both players reveal their cards and dials at the same time. Spells that use less power will go before spells that use more.

You will play best two out of three matches. As the game progresses, you will learn more about the cards in your opponent’s hand, and be able to better guess when to counterspell and stop them! No matter how many powerful spells you bring a wizard duel, the key to victory is understanding your opponent!

-description from designer

This is a simple roll and move game.

During set-up, each player takes a coloured playing piece and four teddy weather cards, each depicting a teddy bear dressed for different weather (snowy, windy, sunny, and rainy weather).

On a player's turn, the active player selects one teddy weather card and they then spin the weather spinner. If the weather selected by the spinner matches the teddy weather card chosen by the player, then the player can roll the dice and move that many spots on the board.

If a player lands on a storm cloud space they must return to the start.

The first player to reach the honey pot at the centre of the board wins.

This is an educational game for young children to help them learn their colours.

The game contains 36 learning cards, 6 wild cards, and 4 double-sided game boards. With these components, it's possible to play one of the five games in the box.

The five games are:
- Matching Pictures of the Same Color
- Matching Identical Pictures
- Matching Colors to Words
- "Fish" Game 
- Reach for the Rainbow

Pile the Bones is a dexterity game using pieces shaped like long bones. Each player places a bone on the playing surface to form a square base, then each player in turn places a new bone on the pile. The player who places the bone that collapses the pile scores one point for each bone in the pile. If a player plays the last bone without collapsing the pile that player reduces their score by 10 points. The player with the least points after an agreed number of rounds is the winner. Alternatively the players may play on individual piles of bones. In this case, there is no bonus for playing the last bone.

The game is packaged in a plastic barrel similar to "Barrel of Monkeys"

A trivia game with questions from different time periods in Norwegian history.

Become the first player to reach the level of "Byborger" (Bourgeoisie).

In one of the question category: the first player to answer correctly, gets the points from that question.

ErotiXXX is an adult game for couples that will guide you through a wide-ranging series of erotic challanges. Your endurance will be tested. Sometimes blindfolded you won’t always see what’s going on but you will definitely feel it.

The rules are simple. To play, place your tokens on the Start square, and take turns rolling the die. Each die roll is how many spaces on the board you move – then you do what the board or cards direct. [Sometimes for 2 minutes!] The first player to reach the final square having fully respected the game rules wins! The winner chooses where and how to have their final pleasure. If you ‘lose it’ during the game, you lose the game. But you will never have more fun delaying the outcome of a game.

Make it a hot night to remember for you both with this game.

Game contents include: 1 game board - 1 blindfold - 2 player tokens - 1 die - 3 decks of cards – 1 instruction manual.

The British Counter-Attack at Arras

This game is a collaborative design between Grognard Simulations and Stronpoint Simulations of the British Armies surprise attack on Rommel's 7th Panzer Division at the city of Arras. This game is a lighter version of the Death Ride series and a good introductory game for the series.

The battle is an interesting situation where the British got the drop on Rommel when the Germans were only considering victory and were too confident of success. This is where Hitler began to get nervous about the ever extending flank of the German armored spearheads. Luckily for the Germans (criminals) the British had poor coordination and poor tanks involved in the attack. While they made the Germans nervous and gave a few units some real problems they didn't have much of a chance of cutting off the German spearheads.

This two day battle is one of the high points of the French campaign for the Allies. Players will each find a tense situation at the beginning. The British must try to push hard as far as they can in order to effect a breakthrough. The Germans must stave off the breakthrough and hold on until help arrives. Rommel sent the 25th Panzer Regiment forward and left the softer elements of the division behind. It's these softer elements that come under attack. The 25th Panzer Regiment is the help and they had to turn around and go back in order to stop the British attack.

Game Scales are:
- Game Turns are 15 minutes; a change from most other Death Ride series games
- Hex Scale is 330m per Hex
- Most units are platoons, British infantry are companies

Contents - comes with (in Full Color):
(4) Map Sections of the Arras France Area of Operations
(3) Counter Sheets with over 600 Units and Markers
(2) Scenario Cards
(2) d10 and (1) d6
58 Pg. Master Rules (FREE download for those who choose the LITE version)
Supplemental Rules Specific to Arras
Order of Battle Cards
Command and Control Enhancement Built In
Fire Support Enhancement Built In

"Qui ose gagne" (Who Dares Wins) is a solitaire wargame where you are in command of Long Range Desert Group commando patrols in the 1942 Cyrenaica region of Libya.
Troubles do not only come from italian and german troops ! But you will have to keep a low profile, to face natural or mechanical incidents and manage the outbound road to your home base after the execution of the mission. Success or failure level impacts the next missions.

Components:

 A3 map
 108 die-cut counters




VaeVictis magazine issue 140

Astoria is a land bustling with productivity and growth! New towns, factories, and railroads are springing up across the land. A few savvy business tycoons (you and your opponents) are determined to make your fortunes on the crest of this wave. These tycoons start out as the producers of the key commodities: wheat to feed the growing towns and factories, wood and iron to build them, coal to fuel the trains and factories, and manufactured goods and luxuries to fill the insatiable demand of the animals of Astoria.

Cornering the market for the most valuable commodities can create small fortunes that can be invested in the new businesses, turning them into huge fortunes. The sky is the limit during this Gilded Age!

In Raccoon Tycoon, players try to produce the most valuable commodities in an ever-changing marketplace. They then use those commodities to build towns, or sell them at the best price to secure great profits that can be used to win auctions for the all-important railroads. The profits may also be used to buy powerful buildings that give the players power-ups or bonuses in production. Owning the best towns and railroads determines victory. There can be only one "top dog" in Astoria. Is it you?

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
A world of knowledge... gallivanting the globe from your home or classroom. Expeditious expeditions of adventure in learning. A geography game played on an authentic and colorfully detailed world map. Fun and educational for teens and adults.

The game comes with four different categories of card (flags, general, capitals, countries). Players roll and move their pawn on a track. Each space on the track represents the color of card that must be answered. In order to move again on the same turn, players must answer their trivia cards correctly. For flag cards, players are shown a country flag with three possible answers on them. They must choose the correct answer to move again. General cards ask various questions related to physical or social geography. Country cards ask players to identify what country is being referred to on the map (each country of the world has been numbered on the board). Finally, players must identify the capital city of a specified country when they land on a country card.

To win the game, the player who lands on the finish space and answers one final trivia question correctly wins the game.

Players try to collect objects of the main characters of the Tintin comics: rum of Captain Haddock, the umbrella of Professor Calculus, the music score of Castafiore and the walking sticks of Thompson and Thomson.

When players have collected a set, they get bonuses and they can change the sets for Tintinors (money).

The player that first reaches a number of Tintinors, wins.

A two-player chess variant that is played on the CirSquare 96 (a unique circular board merged with a square board). The object of the game is the same as for traditional chess--checkmate the opponent's King.

The board (24"x24", double-sided, quad-fold, custom designed) has 96 spaces and divided into 2 castles of 24 spaces each and a battlefield of 4 rows with 12 spaces each. Numerous initial board setups are possible. Up to 4 additional or new power pieces can be used. The game comes with 2 new optional pieces--Archer and Catapult--which compliment the Knight, Bishop, and Rook.

All the traditional chess pieces move as they do in traditional chess. See the game rules for how the Archer and Catapult move. Castling works like it does in traditional chess only if the standard chess setup for the power pieces is used.

The board has 4 triangular spaces. When a Queen or Bishop moves into a triangle across a corner, it can exit across either of the other 2 corners. When a Queen or Rook moves into a triangle across a side, it can exit across either of the other 2 sides. Thus, the pieces gain an extra path (a 5th path) of coverage when they are aligned with a triangular space, which is often a great advantage, especially in the middle and end games.

—description from the publiser

This entry is 'level 2' of the games contained in Castle Strife Games. Each level is a game in its own right, but the earlier levels also serve to gradually introduce the rules of Castle Siege. This level is the most chess-like.

The Battle of Prokhorovka was fought on 12 July 1943 near Prokhorovka, 87 kilometres (54 mi) southeast of Kursk in the Soviet Union, during the Second World War. Taking place on the Eastern Front, the engagement was part of the wider Battle of Kursk, and occurred when the 5th Guards Tank Army of the Soviet Red Army attacked the II SS-Panzer Corps of the German Wehrmacht in one of the largest tank battles in military history.

Can you break through the enemy lines and fight back with the Red Army. Will you lead the Soviet forces to victory by controlling the clash in the last German attack on the Eastern Front?

This game covers the attack of 4th Panzer Army and Army Detachment Kempf on the southern part of the Kursk salient. Units are randomly assigned tank and equipment chits at start. There are also single-use support chits which include fighters, bombers, heavy artillery, smoke, minefields, engineers, and snipers.

Time scale: 1 day per turn
Unit scale: German divisions to battalions; Soviet corps to regiments
Counters: 198 9/16"
Map: A2 (42 x 59.4 cm)
Duration: July 5-14 1943


Included with Game Journal #63.

It is the hope of every literary character that their tale will inspire people for generations to come. But how can people be inspired by your story if it’s on the banned books list? Your story MUST be told, and it's time for you to take matters into your own hands!

Banned Books is a solo game featuring ousted literary characters fighting back against the Powers-That-Be to restore their books to the shelves. Each turn you will select actions that will progress your agenda track, hamper the agenda tracks of the Powers, utilize your characters unique abilities or manipulate your tableau. If you can advance your progress token quickly enough to convince 2 of the 3 Powers-That-Be to remove your book from the banned list, you win. But if the majority of the Powers advance their tokens and make up their minds first, or drain your characters stamina, you will be banished from shelves forever!

-description from publisher

A social deduction game for 3 to 4 players.

Welcome, team. Here is your mission for today. Your task is to liberate the captured base by sending in 12 agents. The good news is that if an agent's identity can be kept hidden, that agent can do the work of two normal agents. However, we believe the enemy may have sent an infiltrator who will try to sabotage our plan.

Team Zodiac may be played using standard playing cards or with the zodiacâ€themed deck found in the files section. Players take turns playing an agent card either face up or face down. Face down cards count double. Some cards may also be used to accuse another player of being the infiltrator. The players win either by playing enough agent cards or by correctly accusing the infiltrator. The infiltrator, if there is one, wins by foiling the playing of agent cards without being detected.

This is an updated version of a game created for the April 2017 24 Hour Contest.

-description from designer

Get Organized is a mafia-based card and dice game. The goal is to accumulate 100 or more points by collecting “Industry Cards.” Each player begins with 1 of each industry card in play (Strip Clubs, Drug Trafficking, Waste Management, Money Laundering, Gambling Ring and Law Enforcement). Each turn begins with a “Collect” phase, where the player takes $200 from the “stash.” Then there is a “Purchase” phase, where they player may choose to purchase more industry cards (kept in their hand for now, but not in play) or bullets to attack with. Next is the “Attack” phase, where the player can choose to roll dice to “shoot the bullets” at another player’s industry cards. If a 4+ is rolled, the player takes that card and adds it to his/her industry cards in play. Finally, there is the “Build” phase, which is when a player may play one industry card that was purchased earlier.

The first player to accumulate 3 of any one industry card in play, “owns” that industry and gains the benefits of it (for example, the person who owns the Gambling Ring gets to roll a die during his/her collect phase and collects $100 X the number they roll, in addition to the $200 they already collect). Every time an industry is taken over, the player who now owns it gets to pull a “Good Earner” card, which can be saved and used at any time (for example, there is a bullet proof vest, which makes bullets only hit on 5’s and 6’s for one attack phase).

After each round, the player with the most industry cards in play (not counting the ones purchased but not played yet) is the “Rat.” They must pull a rat card, which almost always has a negative action that must be taken. The Rat goes first in the next round, which isn’t always a good thing.

Each industry card in play is worth 5 points, but once the player owns the industry, all the cards within that industry are worth 10 points for that player. The game ends when there are one or more players over 100 points at the end of the round (the one with the most points wins). If someone gets over 100 points in the middle of a round, others can attack that player to reduce their points to less than 100.

—description from the publisher

Fighter In Sight is an aerial-based game for two players or more, which recounts the WW2 battles.

Minimum length: 45 minutes (Playing can take longer, depending on scenario size and number of players) At the controls of your fighter planes, will you dare you to fight the fearsome Messerschmitt 109E over England, or the famous Japanese Zeros over the Pacific Ocean ? Will you succeed this battle ? Or will you have to escape the flaming wreck ? Fighter In Sight, with its historical scenarios, will allow you to relive this all over again. The game proposes a fresh approach of aerial combat. It will allow you to make mass struggle by involving many squadrons. Fighter In Sight was created with rules that will become more difficult as you play more scenarios. For example, when playing the first scenario you will learn how to use the speedometer. When playing the second one, you will also learn about the fuel management, and so on. The progressive rules have been prepared to address families as well as experienced players. It offers a simple, fast, realistic and easy to assimilate gameplay. It is possible to increase the realism and the difficulty level with additional parameters. Documenting and researching about historical background and technical facts has been an important part of the creation of Fighter in Sight so that the game would respect as much as possible the spirit of air combat, and still remain easy to play.

—description from the designer

Love Battle High School is harem anime-style adventure where you get to decide the story! The awkward Hiroshi suddenly finds himself the object of the affections of five beautiful classmates: his longtime friend, Yuki, former student council president Rin, the voluptuous Katsumi, little firecracker Sakiko, and Aika, the spiritualist. Help him sort out which of the girls he will take on a date!

Pick your favorite girl and vote for the One True Match, or if you can’t pick just one, try for a Love Triangle by voting for two girls. You have an entire school day (seven class periods) to make sure that your choice has the most Love for Hiroshi by date time. If you do, you gain Ki, and whoever has the most Ki by date time is ready for the date and wins the game. Along the way, you will control Hiroshi during the Hero Phase, and all five girls during the Girl Phase. You get to decide which order to take these phases each period, in order to make your story turn out the way you want it to. Gain Plot Points by fulfilling certain situations to boost your Ki and ensure victory.

Watch out though, as other players will also be trying to manipulate the students to create their own favorite pair. Other players won't be the only obstacles to your success, as other students and staff members come along to meddle in the action and stir up the plot. Can you emerge the strongest and be ready for the date with your One True Match?

—description from the publisher

name.value: 2nd Megiddo: King Josiah vs. Pharaoh Necho II

item.description:
Archers, chariots, javelin throwers, infantry, initiative, and the Mount of Megiddo itself all play their part. This is a two player non-card driven war game. The Egyptians have to get 1/3rd of their forces, within a time limit, off the opposite map board edge. The Judeans either have to delay them, or inflict sufficient losses on them. Historically, the Egyptian forces were on their way to help their allies the Assyrians against the Babylonians. To do so, they had to pass through Judean territory. We do not know why Josiah went to war against Egypt. The Assyrian capital, Ninevah, had already fallen to the Babylonians and Medes in 612 (read Nahum). The remaining Assyrian forces had regrouped at Haran, but in 609 they were forced west of the Euphrates. It appears to be at this time that the Egyptians under Necho II were coming to the Assyrian’ aid. King Josiah marched out to meet them in battle. Perhaps Josiah opposed the passage of Necho’s forces through the pass at Megiddo (See 2 Chron.35:20-24) because he feared that the growth of either Egyptian or Assyrian power would have adverse results for the continued independence of Judah. (TKB 2 Kings 23:29). Pharaoh Necho II sent word to Josiah that God had told him to immediately attack Babylon “so stop opposing God who is with me, or He will destroy you.” (35:21) Yet, Josiah refused to accept the word of the Lord from Pharaoh Necho II and went to fight against him on the plain of Megiddo. “Josiah, however, would not turn away from him, but disguised himself to engage him in battle. He would not listen to what Pharaoh Necho II has said at God’s command but went to fight him on the plain of Megiddo.” (35:22) Josiah was wounded by an archer in battle and died in Jerusalem and was buried in the tombs of his fathers (35:23-24). There was great mourning in Judea and Jerusalem. This is 2nd Megiddo, King Josiah vs Pharaoh Necho II. Can you change history?

—description from the publisher

In Exodus: Moses vs Pharaoh: will you like Moses lead your people out of slavery and into freedom? Will the Hebrew Elders support your leadership? Will a decades old murder charge be brought against you? Will Pharaoh relent and “Let My People Go!” Will Joseph’s Bones be transported for re-burial? Will you plunder the Egyptians to make up for 400 years of slavery? Will Aaron and Hur be at your right and left hand?

As Pharaoh, will you keep the Hebrew slaves in order? Will your building programs proceed on schedule? Will your magicians defeat Moses at his own game? Will the gods of the Egyptians protect Egypt from the great I Am? How will the supernatural plagues be dealt with? Will your chariots crush the slave revolt before they escape across the Red Sea? Will you succeed where your historical counterpart failed?

Exodus is a card driven game of ten turns. Moses must lead the Hebrew people out of Egypt and across the Red Sea to freedom. If Moses fails then Pharaoh wins.

—description from the publisher

In Joshua: Hebrews vs Pagans; will you like Joshua conquer the promised land? Will you avoid the Sin of Achen and the Plague of Peor? Will you be tricked by the Gibeonites? Will Caleb and Othneil be at your right and left hand? Will the Ark of the Covenant remain safely in the hands of Eleazar, Phineas, and the Levites? Will 1 of your soldiers put to flight a 1,000 of the enemy?
As the Pagans, how long will Ai hold out? Will you keep Balam the Son of Beor from Hebrew justice? Will you unite to defeat the Hebrews? Will you take advantage of Hidden Movement, Concealed Pieces, Fortified Cities, and Siege Sorties? Will you utilize off-board Ambushes, the Iron Chariots of the Canaanites, and the might of the Philistine Anakin to drive the Hebrew invaders back across the Jordan River?

Joshua is card driven game. Joshua must conquer three of the major tribes, or two of the major tribes and most of the minor tribes in order to win. The Pagans win by stopping Joshua.

—description from the publisher

name.value: III Caesars: Roman Civil War of AD 69

item.description:
Rome had been a Republic with Senators for about 500 years. Then came the line of emperors: Julius, Augustus, Tiberius, Calligula, Claudius, and then the sixth evil Emperor Nero. After the beast Nero committed suicide in AD 68 after an attempt to prove he was God incarnate, it appeared the Roman Empire had received a fatal wound to its head (leadership) which could not be healed. Three Caesars: The Roman Civil War of AD 69 re-creates this struggle. Galba, Ortho, and Vitellius engaged in a war where Romans fought against their fellow Romans to see who would become the next emperor of Rome. 
Historically, none of them succeeded, either militarily or politically. Can you succeed where they failed? If not, General Vespasian is on his way to Rome to proclaim himself emperor, and begin the Flavian Dynasty.

III Caesars is a card driven game wherein the first player to get to Rome, conquer it, and acquire 10 political points wins immedaitely.

—description from the publisher

Jet Ace is a simulation of tactical jet combat from 1944 to the near future. Over 140 different types of fighters, attack aircraft and bombers are available to be flown on limitless missions. The basic game is easy to learn and can be played in less than one hour. From there, you progress to the advanced game, with different types of missiles, bombing missions, electronic countermeasures, anti-aircraft guns, SAMs, helicopters, ships and much more.m

Legends of Novus is a fantasy adventure game, placing you in control of a heroic character who is embarking on a journey across the mythical world of Novus in an effort to help rid the world of powerful creatures who are terrorizing the lands...

The game is designed for 1-5 players, ages 13+, and takes between 60 to 90 minutes to play (less for Solo play).

The game has a combination of a physical character sheet and card based equipment attached to it. The variety of initial characters, and classes they can advance to make the game re-playable with a different game play experience each time. The world story, and the ability to navigate the world with a free roam aspect (and no dice rolling controlling how far or where you can travel to), gives the players a strong sense of control over their fate. The multiple paths to gaining XP also give the players a chance to explore different character strengths and game strategies in their goal to become a Legend of Novus.

—description from the publisher

Are you in the market for some revolutionary diet pills? A hair-growth treatment centre? How about a nice, old fashioned Russian dating website? Well, you will be soon!

Each round in Clickbait, you flip over a product card, roll the five letter dice, then use these letters to write an advert for some of the strangest products that the internet has to offer. When you're satisfied, hand over your phrase to the judge. Once they've picked their favorite, a new product gets revealed, and the dice are rolled again. The first player to write three pieces of award-winning clickbait wins!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Ever wondered what a strange place the internet can be? Well now there's a game to prove it. In Weird Things Humans Search For, your job is to predict the most popular endings to Google search questions. Examples include "Why can't I… own a Canadian" and "My cat wants… to kill me".

You get two guesses, which you must rank. The more popular your guess turns out to be, the more points you'll win, with a bonus if your top guess is also the top result. After five rounds, points are tallied to determine a winner.

As a recently-crowned Dwarven King, you'd quite like a palace. Your followers would rather spend their days fighting amongst themselves and drinking. Good luck with that.

Hall of the Dwarven King is a dice game for one player. Each of your seven dice represents the whims of one of your followers, Sometimes they'll feel like mining or building, but just as often, they'd rather drink or get into fights.

Try to order them around too much and they'll just walk off. So if you want a palace (Which, of course you do) you'll need to work around the Dwarves' inclinations, build Taverns and Gaming halls so they'll be happier doing what you say, or just bribe them if you have the cash.

All you need to play Hall of the Dwarven King is the PDF, a pencil and seven standard dice.

As long as there has been magic, there have been Mages' Towers. Tall, dilapidated structures built in wild curves to tap into elemental energy. As the Solstice approaches, three Wizards break ground on what they're sure will be... Well, it will be a tower anyway.

Tower of Mages is a dice game for one player. Each of your three dice represents a scatterbrained wizard with a short attention span. Over the course of the game they will be working together to build a tower to gather elemental energies, convert them into valuable spells, and to predict and manipulate the spell market.

The game uses a sort-of-rondel mechanic. You roll your dice and choose which order to play them in. Each time you use a die, you count down the list of tower segments, starting at the last segment built.

There is also a market speculation aspect, all Elements begin at a value of -2. As the game progresses, you will roll dice to see how values grow and fall. To make the best of this, you can build high value rooms, destroy negatively valued rooms, cap towers to score them early, and gain rerolls to adjust the outcomes of the market.

All you need to play is the PDF, three standard dice and a pencil.
